meanings.definition: Capable of being changed or adjusted.
meanings.sent1: The shirt was modifiable, so I could make it shorter.
meanings.sent2: She found a modifiable template online to customize her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The modifiable puzzle kept changing its shape, making it tricky to solve.
meanings.sent4: His modifiable attitude towards challenges allowed him to adapt quickly.
meanings.sent5: The modifiable settings on the camera made it easy to adjust for different lighting conditions.

meanings.definition: Able to be altered or adapted.
meanings.sent1: The recipe was modifiable, so she could use different ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The modifiable schedule allowed for changes to be made easily.
meanings.sent3: The modifiable storybook had interactive pages that could be changed.
meanings.sent4: Her modifiable approach to problem-solving made her very versatile.
meanings.sent5: The modifiable design of the building allowed for future expansions.

meanings.sent1: The contract was modifiable, pending approval from both parties.
meanings.sent2: The modifiable policy could be updated based on new information.
meanings.sent3: The modifiable map kept changing as new roads were built.
meanings.sent4: Her modifiable decision-making process ensured flexibility in her plans.
meanings.sent5: The modifiable nature of the software allowed for continuous improvements.
